> Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

I understand that we don't want 2 recordings to be triggered when the user only meant to start one. But there are use cases for making multiple recordings at the same time. For example, you may be recording the whole run, but also trigger smaller recordings throughout during runtime.

~~Gazebo-classic supports this either through the GUI or the `gz log --record` command line tool.~~ Actually, I take that back, it doesn't do what I would expect :grimacing:

How about adding some notes around `public: static bool started;` mentioning that this enforcement may be removed in the future?
content.html:
Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

I understand that we don't want 2 recordings to be triggered when the user only meant to start one. But there are use cases for making multiple recordings at the same time. For example, you may be recording the whole run, but also trigger smaller recordings throughout during runtime.

Gazebo-classic supports this either through the GUI or the gz log --record command line tool. Actually, I take that back, it doesn't do what I would expect

How about adding some notes around public: static bool started; mentioning that this enforcement may be removed in the future?
